  • Description: On June 01, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN3265 leaked approximately less than one (<1) gallon to the lid of the drum due to a faulty lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized an absorbent pad to wipe the product off of the drum lid. The absorbent pad was disposed of through RLC's waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023060800
item.description:
Report X-2023060800

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/16/2023 at approximately 0315, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved a call from Employee 220288 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 4 paint cans, packed in a sectioned fiberboard box. 3 paint cans (base component) had ring locks for positive closure. The 4th can (paint thinner) had a protruding screw cap. 1 of the 4 cans was crushed inward on its bottom chime. This damage allowed the leakage of contents. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/21/2023 at approximately 1500, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069, reporting a lithium battery shipment emitting a charred odor. The shipment consisted of two plastic coolers, coverted into modified battery sources and other nonessential content, all packaged in a fiberboard box. Further investigation revealed that the wires of one of the coolers appeared fused together and, apparently, the source of the odor. An NRC report was filed under report #1367880. The package were not emitting heat, so no further mitigation was required. The shipment is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: On 5/20/2023 at approximately 1535, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5080897 at the hub facility in Memphis , reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 8 fiberboard boxes, each with 4-1 liter cans of paint inside. One of the packages was discovered leaking. The cause of the spillage was unknown. This spill caused outer package damage to two other packges in this shipment, under AWB#s 640103287503 and 640103287525. The leaking inner packages were placed in a salvage drum and are set for dsiposal. The remaining contents of all three pacakges were placed in a separate salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaratrion fr further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023060264
item.description:
Report X-2023060264

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin were alerted to the presence of a leaking hazmat within a rail trailer in outbound load area 3. Spillage absorbed, package removed from operations, and package handler questioned for exposure/adverse symptoms. DescribePack: One of the six metal 1 gallon cans experienced a release of 0.2 gallons via a loose inner metal seal (see ISF picture of seal embossed with "CUT THIS OUT"). 4 of 6 jerricans also had loose inner seals but experienced minimal loss of product. Dented bottom corners of 5/6 containers and loosened caps is consistent with vented/leaked product from a dropped box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package and spillage placed within a lined tote for transport to HMPA. PPE donned and ventilation utilized for reporting.

item.title: Report X-2023060222
item.description:
Report X-2023060222

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, unmarked fiberboard box found on loadside, containing spray bottle cleaners. Package transported to HMPA for investigation. DescribePack: Hazardous Material: two of the two 22oz bottles of Starbrite Mildew Stain Remover lost a combined 25oz due to loose/cracked spray nozzles. Non-hazardous material: one of the two 32oz bottles of Starbrite Instant Hull Cleaner Gel Formula lost all 32oz due to a loose spray nozzle. The spray bottles were lying sideways in the outer packaging; no orientation arrows were applied to suggest another desired orientation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined and lidded tote. PPE and ventilation was used. SDS consulted.

  • Description: During normal switching operation a train crew observed liquid running down the side of the car and originating from the area of the manway. The car was set out and the area was isolated. I response contractor was called to investigate and repair the leaking car. The contractor found the single bolt on the clincher style manway was less than tool tight. The manway was opened and the gasket was inspected but no defects were noted. The manway was resecured in a tool tight condition. The contractor also inspected the other fittings and no exceptions were found. The exterior of the car was neutralized and cleaned. No product reached the ground.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was notified of Hazardous spill on loadside. PPE was applied and package was inspected. Spillage was contained and package was pulled from sortation and placed in bag lined tote with cleanup and brought to hazcage for further inspection. No injuries resulting from this spillage. Due to nature of damage it is believed that a package fell from the sortation belt onto the hazmat, causing the internal damage. DescribePack: Large dent on lower side of internal container, created break that allowed leaking of contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spillage was contained and package was pulled from sortation and placed in bag lined tote with cleanup and brought to hazcage for further inspection. No injuries resulting from this spillage.

  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called for a leaking fiberboard box that had been dropped during sort operations.
